request_pathways.name: Mail to Medical Records at 7373 Perkins Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70808
Medical Records email (medrecords@brclinic.com) — listed for questions, potentially usable for submission
Medical Records phone (225-246-9770) — for urgent requests and questions

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient downloads a 1-page Right of Access PDF citing HIPAA § 164.524, but the form is framed as designee authorization rather than self-request, and must be printed and filled by hand.

red_flags: Right of Access form is framed as designee-only authorization with no clear self-request option
No submission instructions on the Right of Access form — patient has no guidance on where to send it
Form-1 (third-party release) requires Social Security Number as a mandatory field
bright_spots: Three-form strategy differentiates outbound release, inbound transfer, and Right of Access
Right of Access form explicitly cites HIPAA 45 C.F.R. § 164.524
Electronic delivery option offered on Right of Access form
Right of Access form is admirably concise at 1 page
No SSN or hold-harmless clause on the Right of Access form

findability.rationale: Level 4: Forms are easy to find on a well-organized downloadable forms page with no barriers; the Right of Access form was not surfaced by web search but was readily found on the page itself.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 2: All forms are flat PDFs with zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite workflow; no fax number provided, no explicit electronic submission pathway, and submission instructions are absent from the primary form.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: The Right of Access form is well-organized, concise (1 page), uses plain language, and follows a logical flow; minor issues include lack of date-range scoping and no explicit instructions.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: The clinic maintains a dedicated Right of Access form separate from third-party release, but its designee-only framing means a patient requesting their own records must figure out how to adapt the form for self-access.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: The Right of Access form correctly cites HIPAA authority, avoids SSN collection and hold-harmless clauses, and imposes no notarization or in-person requirements; minor gap is the absence of fee disclosure and response time commitment.

overall.summary: The Baton Rouge Clinic shows above-average awareness with a dedicated Right of Access form and three-form differentiation, but flat non-fillable PDFs, unclear submission methods, and designee-only framing on the access form hold back the overall patient experience.
